meanings.definition: To exceed in bulk or size.
meanings.sent1: The blue whale outbulks all other animals in the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The giant elephant outbulks the smaller animals in the jungle.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant tried to outbulks the big beetle in a size competition.
meanings.sent4: The mountain outbulks the hills in grandeur and majesty.
meanings.sent5: The massive ship outbulks the tiny rowboats in the harbor.

meanings.definition: To surpass in quantity or amount.
meanings.sent1: The buffet outbulks the small snack bar in food options.
meanings.sent2: The generous donation outbulks all the previous contributions.
meanings.sent3: The overflowing treasure chest tried to outbulks the small piggy bank.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter outbulks the quiet whispers in the room.
meanings.sent5: The overflowing river outbulks the small stream in water volume.
